author: Sonam Saigal
text:
Rejecting the Enforcement Directorate’s request for a seven-day custody, a Special Prevention of Money Laundering Act court on Thursday remanded the Nationalist Congress Party leader Chhagan Bhujbal in judicial custody till March 31.

The agency’s lawyer Hiten Venegavkar informed the court that the ED got only one day to question Mr Bhujbal and that it was impossible to carry out any investigation as he complained of chest pain on Wednesday evening. He said doctors were summoned from JJ Hospital and St George’s Hospital and all them opined that he was “fit and fine”. He said the agency was unable to confront Mr Bhujbal and his nephew Sameer together on statements made by some witnesses.

He added that there has been a cash flow of Rs 200 crore that took place inside the Mumbai Education Trust (MET) and on being questioned about it, Mr Bhujbal, who is the chairman of the educational institute, would say, “I don’t know”. Urging for an extension of his custody, Mr Venegavkar said the “crucial part (of the investigation) has not been completed.”

The court observed that sufficient ground has not been made out by the ED to collect independent evidence against the accused (Bhujbal).
title: Bhujbal sent to jail, ED custody plea rejected
